name: juanma-jwt-auth-pro
description: Simple, secure JWT authentication for WordPress REST API

scripts.test:setup: wp-env run tests-cli bash -c 'wp plugin activate juanma-jwt-auth-pro 2>/dev/null || true'
scripts.test: npm run test:setup && npm run test:unit && npm run test:integration && npm run test:behat
scripts.test:unit: npm run test:setup && wp-env run tests-cli --env-cwd=wp-content/plugins/juanma-jwt-auth-pro vendor/bin/phpunit --testsuite=unit --testdox
scripts.test:integration: npm run test:setup && wp-env run tests-cli --env-cwd=wp-content/plugins/juanma-jwt-auth-pro vendor/bin/phpunit --testsuite=integration --testdox
scripts.test:behat: npm run test:setup && composer run behat
scripts.plugin:check: wp-env run tests-cli wp plugin check juanma-jwt-auth-pro --exclude-directories=tests,bin --exclude-files=.gitignore,.phpunit.result.cache,.distignore
scripts.preplugin:build: docker ps --format '{{.Names}}' | grep tests-cli | xargs -I {} docker exec -u root {} apk add --no-cache zip git 2>/dev/null || true
scripts.review:help:
echo 'Available review commands:
  npm run review        - Review staged changes
  npm run review:staged - Same as review
  npm run review:last   - Review the last commit
  npm run review:commit <SHA> - Review a specific commit
  npm run review:ai     - Get AI-friendly output for staged changes'

author: JuanMa Garrido
